snippet: Officials will begin forensic tests to determine if charred human remains in a burned-out cabin are those of Christopher J. Dorner, the former Los Angeles police officer sought in the region’s largest manhunt.
abstract: Officials will begin forensic tests to determine if charred human remains in a burned-out cabin in Big Bear Lake, Calif, are those of Christopher J Dorner, the former Los Angeles police officer sought in the region’s largest manhunt; he had holed up in cabin hours earlier and engaged deputies in shootout, killing one deputy and wounding a second.

byline.original: By IAN LOVETT, JENNIFER MEDINA, MICHAEL WILSON and FERNANDA SANTOS
byline.contributor: Ian Lovett reported from Big Bear Lake, Jennifer Medina from Los Angeles, Michael Wilson from New York, and Fernanda Santos from San Bernardino, Calif. Rebecca Fairley Raney contributed reporting from Big Bear Lake.

lead_paragraph: Officials will begin forensic tests to determine if charred human remains in a burned-out cabin are those of Christopher J. Dorner, the former Los Angeles police officer sought in the region’s largest manhunt.

headline.seo: Fugitive Ex-Officer Believed Dead in Cabin
headline.main: Authorities to Determine if Remains Are of California Fugitive
headline.print_headline: Fugitive Ex-Officer Is Believed Dead in Cabin
